title: Bring back Tristana's Range
body:
And I don't mean half-ass it and meet halfway, I mean full on original passive.

And maybe an attack speed per level buff to compensate for damages.

I kid you not Riot you took away her identity, and I NEVER complained that you "gutted" a champ until now.
Please. Please give us back what made her unique.

replies.body:
Now, I'm not a Tristana main. I play her sometimes, because I like her kit, but I tend to do that with a lot of champions. This is just my opinion.

She lost 34 range. Yes, she went from just over 700 to just under 670 at max, but I don't think it's the range loss that cut into her strength. I believe it is because she lost 42.5% AS from her per-level gain over her two AS per-level nerfs. **She lost 42.5% out of 68% innate attack speed, dropping her from 1.102 to 0.823 at level 18.**

The range loss is not nothing, *per se*, but the AS nerfs are a bit more significant. Especially since her E stacks based on attacks. And her Q got a shorter duration, and only +20% more AS, not quite compensating for the loss gap.
Both nerfs were uncalled for. Either nerf one or the other, but you can't nerf two core aspects of tristana's kit and expect her to not have a trash winrate.

And then for some reason Lucian's is even worse this patch... but yes, I still agree that she has needed buffs ever since her "rework". They have been slowly buffing her, so maybe she will eventually become a decent champion with the buffs they keep giving her small buffs over time. I would like to see her get her range and as/lvl back, but it doesn't seem like Riot are willing to go in that direction. She doesn't even beat Caitlyn in range until level 16 now @_@. I say she needs buffs, but I somehow do well with her when i pick her (this is Plat/Diamond normal games, so whatever).
I think Lucian's win rate is more of a side effect of the Tank Meta and him being a bit more burst than most ADC (without true damage), which tanks normally counter.
He applies BotRK twice with his passive though... He is a decently high skillcap champion, but I don't think his win rate should be the lowest of all ADCs...
That is true, his play rate has been increasing relative to his win rate, so it may really be just inexperienced players causing it to decrease and not itemizing effectively.
Lucian was too overpowered and he received too many direct and indirect nerfs, at least some of them should be reverted. Ult CD, range, AD scaling on W etc.

Tristana's primary identity is having a scaling auto attack range that maxes out at the **longest** auto attack range in the game, bar none, including auto attack range modifying abilities, and being an end game hyper carry.

Twitch's R always made him have the highest auto attack range in the game at 850. Old Trist was well below that.

I agree 100% that having a very long scaling ranged attack is her core identity, but twitch has always had higher range.
But Twitch's (and Kog's) range modifiers came from a buff. A level 18 tristana had permanent access to her increased range.

**My personal opinion**
-------------------------------------------------------
As someone who used to main Tristana in Season 4 and tried to main her again Season 5, I would have to agree that her nerfs are indeed a bit harsh. I feel that she has been removed from the whole hyper-carry role and thrown into a weird support-carry role. Her laning is extremely harsh with the lowered AS, and her range doesn't help her much to trade since other carries have more reliable ways to trade (Buckshot, Tumble, Jinx Q, etc). Although Tristana has self peel with her Ulti and Rocket Jump, there isn't much reason to pick her over Jinx who does just about the same thing, but with more damage and persistent attack speed, and is even stronger in teamfights. 

Furthermore, I believe that in order for Tristana to excel at all in-game she has to either snowball extremely hard, or rely on her teammates, so that she can push turrets as a 5man or split push while 4 others pull pressure. Due to Tristana's lack of AS during laning phase, she loses tremendous amounts of damage since she can't properly stack her E unless the enemy just decides to stand still. Compared to Jinx, there isn't a whole lot of reason to pick Tristana, since Jinx is technically safer with longer range, MS buff on kill/assist, and also her slow and traps. Jinx has basically taken over the role of Tristana's hyper-carry role leaving Tristana to be in a bit of a weird spot, since she doesn't really hyper-carry, and she's not really a support. 

Moreover, in order to remedy this, I feel that Riot should just revert the AS nerfs or at least buff her AS, but keep the range nerfs in order to bring Tristana back to her hyper-carry role. 670 Range is plenty for a champion like Tristana that can escape with Rocket Jump or knock multiple enemies away, and the lack of range may also act as counter-play as she will have to be a lot closer to auto-attack enemies. Furthermore, this would make Tristana a great contender with Jinx, as Tristana would offer more turret pushing power with her increased AS whereas Jinx would offer more Range and Damage.
